content: Being described as "self-reliant" often conveys an inability to ask for help from others. Schaumberg's research into perceptions of leaders in the workplace found that self-reliance connotes a different meaning for female leaders; they are viewed as similarly competent, but more communal compared to self-reliant male leaders.
